bio:
KEFF is a Taiwanese-American multidisciplinary artist based in New York and Taipei.

He is an open-format DJ and producer that has performed with countless international artists at parties such as Brownies & Lemonade (LA), SHOWER @ Soap (Korea), SUBBEAT @ Cakeshop (Korea) and BangOn! (NYC). His mixes have over 400k streams, and his first remix premiered on Skrillex's NEST HQ.

He is the founder of an umbrella entity called SHOCK AND AWE that focuses on producing meaningful art. Their motto is PROGRESS THROUGH PROVOCATION, and they are active across multiple mediums. Their work has garnered millions of impressions, and coverage in reputable publications.

He is also a writer/film director that recently completed the NYU Graduate Film program on scholarship. His first short film, "Secret Lives of Asians at Night", was supported by the Spike Lee Film Fellowship, and awarded the Jury Prize for Best Asian-American Film by the Director's Guild of America. His second short film, "Taipei Suicide Story", will have its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival (Cin√©fondation.)
